page.title: 02FARMING
page.content: {MOORSTON}IS A MIXED FARM OF approx.520 ACRES SITUATED IN THE GIRVAN VALLEY BETWEEN DAILLY AND CROSSHILL WORKED BY THE FARMER AND THREE FARM HANDS. THE DAY BEGINS AT 5.30am WITH MILKING. THERE ARE 160 COWS MOSTLY FRIESIANS WITH A FEW HOLSTEINS. THE MILK IS COLLECTED BY TANKER AND TAKEN TO ROWNTREE-MACKINTOSH IN GIRVAN TO MAKE CHOCOLATE. MILKING TAKES TWO HOURS WITH HALF AN HOUR TO CLEAN UP UTENSILS AND JARS. BREAKFAST IS FROM 8 TO 8.30. NEXT COMES THE GENERAL FARM WORK- DOSING CATTLE, MAKING HAY AND SILAGE, HARVESTING BARLEY AND SPREADING MANURE MILKING STARTS AGAIN AT 3.45pm AND FOLLOWS THE SAME PROCEDURE AS EARLIER. ON THE FARM THER ARE 140 YOUNG CALVES, MOSTLY FRIESIAN HEIFERS. THEY WILL BE THE FUTURE DAIRY HERD.THERE ARE ALSO A FEW CALVES WHICH WILL BE SOLD AS BEEF.
